citations.narrative:
Several dogs had mats in their hair coat and dirty ears at the time of inspection.
** Female Lhasa Apso #7719 has a moderate amount of reddish-brown thick, greasy debris in both ears.
** Female Cavalier #7803 has a large amount of dark brown thick, greasy debris in the right ear. The debris is matted into
some of the hair in the ears forming clumps. This dog also has mats in the long hair on the outer ear flap of both ears.
** Male Aussie #4532 has mats along his right thorax, affecting approximately six square inches of his body. The mats are
about 1 inch from the skin.
** Female Cavalier #6964 has dense mats on the outer ear flap of both ears.
** Female Cavalier #7688 has a large mat on the outer ear flap of the left ear.
The Program of Vet Care prescribes for the dogs to be brushed, clipped, and/or groomed to prevent matted hair coats;
and for ears to be examined by the applicant frequently to ensure the ears are clean and healthy. Dirty ears and matted
skin can be uncomfortable for the dogs or may be a sign of an underlying problem such as an infection. Correct by
following the Program of Vet Care established by your Attending Veterinarian for healthy and unmatted hair coats and
clean and healthy ears.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or byAugust 24, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Several dogs had mats in their hair coat and dirty ears at the time of inspection.  
 
** Female Lhasa Apso #7719 has a moderate amount of reddish-brown thick, greasy debris in both ears.  
** Female Cavalier #7803 has a large amount of dark brown thick, greasy debris in the right ear. The debris is matted into 
some of the hair in the ears forming clumps. This dog also has mats in the long hair on the outer ear flap of both ears. 
** Male Aussie #4532 has mats along his right thorax, affecting approximately six square inches of his body. The mats are 
about 1 inch from the skin. 
** Female Cavalier #6964 has dense mats on the outer ear flap of both ears.  
** Female Cavalier #7688 has a large mat on the outer ear flap of the left ear.  
 
The Program of Vet Care prescribes for the dogs to be brushed, clipped, and/or groomed to prevent matted hair coats; 
and for ears to be examined by the applicant frequently to ensure the ears are clean and healthy. Dirty ears and matted 
skin can be uncomfortable for the dogs or may be a sign of an underlying problem such as an infection. Correct by 
following the Program of Vet Care established by your Attending Veterinarian for healthy and unmatted hair coats and 
clean and healthy ears. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or byAugust 24, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
